meanings.definition: Of or relating to druids or druidism.
meanings.sent1: The ancient stone circle had a mysterious druidical aura.
meanings.sent2: The forest clearing had a druidical feel with its ancient trees and moss-covered rocks.
meanings.sent3: The druidical robes made the children look like little wizards playing dress-up.
meanings.sent4: The druidical symbols carved into the tree trunk seemed to whisper secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The druidical rituals were performed under the light of the full moon, adding to their mystique.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of druids or their practices.
meanings.sent1: The old man's beard had a druidical appearance, long and tangled.
meanings.sent2: The ancient book contained druidical drawings of mystical creatures.
meanings.sent3: The druidical staff was actually just a gnarled branch the child found in the woods.
meanings.sent4: The druidical chants echoed through the forest, carrying ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The druidical symbols on the standing stones seemed to come alive in the moonlight.
